result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S.B. Eagleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must sign up for probation by 9/13/16.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must have no contact with Peter C..

09/12/2016 CORRECTED TO INDICATE THE ORDERED CONDITION: MUST MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants 2 days sentence credit if revoked.
10/12/16 AMENDED TO REFLECT 0 DAYS FOR LENGTH OF JAIL.

Defendant Michael S.B. Eagleman in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim P.C. makes statement. State relates regarding unknown restitution amount. Defense makes argument. Court relates and indicates hearing will proceed and restitution issue can be addressed at a later date. Defense requests adjournment until all can be resolved at once. Court grants Defendant's request to adjourn the matter.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
DOC made me aware the PSI order was done in error. There will not be a PSI prepared for this file.

Defendant Michael S.B. Eagleman in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. State moves to amend Count 4 to misdemeanor battery as a party to the crime per sec. 940.19(1) and 939.05 of Wis Stats. Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads guilty to amended charge. Bond continues.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
